qas.question: The Irish Sea tunnel was first purposed in what year?
What is the name of the recent proposal of a tunnel between Rosslare and Fishguard ports?

answers.text: The Institute of Engineers of Ireland

qas.question: What is the estimated cost to build the Tusker Tunnel?
In what year was a bridge proposed between County Antrim in Northern Ireland to Galloway, Scotland?
Since which year has the idea of a tunnel through the Antrim Sea been raised?
Which British Sea tunnel has most recently been proposed?
The Tusker Tunnel is located between the islands of Rosslare and?
In what year was a rail tunnel rejected on a different route?
Either of the tunnels, would be the shortest in the world and are estimated to cost how much?

context: The idea of building a tunnel under the Irish Sea has been raised since <a0_0><b5_0>1895<b5_0/><a0_0/>, when it was first investigated. Several potential Irish Sea tunnel projects have been proposed, most recently the <a1_0><b6_0>Tusker Tunnel<b6_0/><a1_0/> between the ports of Rosslare and <b7_0>Fishguard<b7_0/> proposed by <a2_0>The Institute of Engineers of Ireland<a2_0/> in 2004. A rail tunnel was proposed in <b8_0>1997<b8_0/> on a different route, between Dublin and Holyhead, by British engineering firm Symonds. Either tunnel, at 50 mi (80 km), would be by far the longest in the world, and would cost an estimated <a3_0><b9_0>£15 billion or €20 billion<a3_0/>.<b9_0/> A proposal in <a4_0>2007<a4_0/>, estimated the cost of building a bridge from County Antrim in Northern Ireland to Galloway in Scotland at £3.5bn (€5bn).
